channel.title: Saving Cookies? [Flash]
channel.description:
Just a heads up: I don't care whether or not flash/AS3 is [i]dead or a dead language[/i]
I know how to save cookies in flash, but I want to know if it's possible to save them on a server. Meaning every time you clear your cache the data would stay, because it's not on the computer, it's on some form of web server. Yes, I know I'd need to create some form of auth system for that so it knows who is what. I just want to know how to do it. It'd need to be nested in a folder. Ex: mywebsite.info/gameCookies/UserNameOfPerson/theirGameData.whateverformat

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:4, topic:517140”]OK. Then you must use .getLocal() with a custom path and upload that file to the server. When you want to load the file. You download it again to a custom path and load it with .getLocal().

If everything fails, store the data yourself and upload/download the file when you need it.[/quote]
I don’t want to have the risk of that happening, because I plan to finish and post this game on a site (regardless of how shitty it is :P).
I guess an idea to that is along the lines of what you said. Having it save remotely, and download a local version each time
